intro: Erigeron montanensis, commonly known as the mountain blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in open, rocky areas and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and gray-green, while its flowers are blue to purple in color. Erigeron montanensis plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in alpine and subalpine regions.
